meanings.definition: A pin passed through the end of an axle to keep a wheel in position.
meanings.sent1: The linchpins on the cart wheels ensured they stayed securely attached.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic replaced the worn linchpins on the bicycle's wheels.
meanings.sent3: When the linchpins went missing, the wheel started wobbling comically.
meanings.sent4: The linchpins of the operation, the tiny pins held everything together like magic.
meanings.sent5: Without the linchpins, the wheels would have fallen off, causing chaos.

meanings.definition: A person or thing vital to an organization or system.
meanings.sent1: In the company, she was one of the linchpins that kept everything running smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The linchpins of the project were the dedicated team members.
meanings.sent3: Without the linchpins, the office felt like a ship without a captain.
meanings.sent4: She was the linchpin that held the team together through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The linchpins were the unsung heroes who made the event a success.
